title: Poetry, Rhythm, and Rhyme

vocab.definition: Writing that often rhymes and has a special rhythm
A pattern of beats, like in music
Words that end with the same sound
A group of lines in a poem

teachingNotes: Use familiar nursery rhymes and chants. Clap rhythms and emphasize rhyming words. Encourage students to create simple poems.

truefalse.question: Poems always have to rhyme.
expectedAny: some poems rhyme, but not all poems have to

multiplechoice.question: Which words rhyme?
expectedAny: sun and fun both end with -un sound

fillintheblank.question: Roses are red, violets are blue, sugar is sweet, and so are _____.

shortanswer.question: Make up two lines that rhyme about your favorite animal.
expectedAny: any two rhyming lines about animals
